com.ames.uncover.impl

Class DataFetchManager<ITEM>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ames.uncover.impl.DataFetchManager<ITEM>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataAvailableListener<ITEM>

    public class DataFetchManager<ITEM>
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataAvailableListener<ITEM>
    Holds the data fetch queue and performs all grouping optimizations for data fetching. A layer between data model and data fetcher, this class is responsible for all advanced logic.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected long delayWhenPending
      Time to delay the next fetch when the current one is in processing.
      protected long[] fetchInProcessing
      The time since when the last fetching is in processing, or 0 in no such.
      protected long timerExtraDelay
      Make timer to fire slightly later, to make sure delayWhenPending passed

      • requestData

        public void requestData(int page)
        Request to start loading data for the given position. The model will call alreadyFetching(page) to be sure same data are not requested repeatedly.

      • notifyVisibleArea

        public void notifyVisibleArea(int fromInclusive,
                              int endExclusive)
        Notify the area that is currently visible. This can be called at any time to discard pending requests outside the visible area.
        Specified by:
        notifyVisibleArea in interface DataAvailableListener<ITEM>

      • dataUnavailable

        public void dataUnavailable(PrimaryRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: DataAvailableListener
        Notify that data for this range has not been successful. Another queued request may be send. The failed request may potentially be retried.
        Specified by:
        dataUnavailable in interface DataAvailableListener<ITEM>

      • reset

        public void reset()

      • servePending

        protected void servePending()
        Serve pending tasks if the previous tasks have been already acknowledged or takes too long. Only send one at time.

        This method is synchronized because also time thread may call it.

      • setThreads

        public DataFetchManager<ITEM> setThreads(int threads)
